alert.note: Alert for Cass (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued November 09 at 5:38PM CST until November 11 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CST THIS EVENING... ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 AM CST FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy mixed precipitation expected followed by intense snow. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 8 inches and ice accumulations of one tenth to three tenths of an inch. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. For the Winter Weather Advisory, freezing rain. Additional ice accumulations of a light glaze. * WHERE...Cass County. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, from 10 PM this evening to 6 AM CST Friday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 8 PM CST this evening. * IMPACTS...Power outages and tree damage are likely due to the ice. Travel could be nearly impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Mixed precip in the morning will be followed by intense snow and strong winds which may produce near blizzard conditions.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Slow down and use caution while traveling. Prepare for possible power outages. The latest road conditions for North Dakota can be found at dot.nd.gov/travel and for Minnesota at 511mn.org, or by calling 5 1 1 in either state.
